title-group.article-title: Mid-Ranging Scheme for Idle Speed Control of SI Engines

permissions.copyright-statement: Copyright 2007 Society of Automotive Engineers, Inc.

abstract.p: The article describes a model-based control method for idle speed of spark-ignition (SI) engines. It is based on mid-ranging, a multivariable control strategy that is more commonly used in process control. The basic building blocks of the control structure are two PI controllers.

Haugwitz, S. et all. (2005): Anti-Windup in Mid- Ranging Control, In Proceedings of the 44th IEEE Conference on Decision and Control and European Control Conference ECC 2005, Seville, Spain.
Hrovat, D. and Sun, J. (1997): Models and control methodologies for IC engine idle speed control design, Control Eng. Practice, 5, Nr. 8, pp.1093-1100.
Karlsson, M. et all (2005): Reducing Moisture Transients in the Paper-Machine Drying Section with the Mid-Ranging Control Technique, Nordic Pulp and Paper Research Journal, 20:2, pp. 150-156.
